description: Excelente snap, love it for my Apple Music
Thanks this works great for Apple Music on Ubuntu
Thank you so much Marcus Tomlinson, you have done a nice job here.
summary: It now a native, but get the job done

description: well... why not in browser
this is not a native apple music player. works fine. if its convenient for you to have the functionality outside a browser, then this is for you. otherwise it's not.
summary: music.apple.com wrapped in an electron app

description: Thank you apple.
summary: It's rather amazing that apple took the time for linux

description: This is look like web version of apple music
Finally Apple Music on Linux!!!!!!

The app originally choked on the Apple ID API but I got it streaming my custom playlists in no time. The interface seems SLIGHTLY sluggish and I cannot access my ability to share playlists on my User Profile, nor is the Follower/-ing an option AFAIK. Great work so far!
I realize this is a WebView version, and I really appreciate the effort creating this app, but it doesn't work on Ubuntu Studio v20.x Audio works for me using FireFox without issues.
summary: Thank you for the effort, but no Audio during playback

description: Amazing UI which is much better than the one for win10. No crashes so far.
Good app for listening apple musics.

Imported everything.

I did need to download a DRM protection software though.

I think it's great! Now I don't have to use my browser to play. I wish you could integrate it with Linux more, like having the ability to control playback through the keyboard or in notifications like the Spotify app. But a client alone is fantastic!
summary: Add some Linux integration if possible!

description: It's a webwrapper but it works, you get access to the apple music web beta as a seperate sandboxed app and it even downloads widevine for you
whenever i try to play a music,it shows"content_equivalent"
Works great on my end. Thank you!

can log in to my account. but just get a message saying "CONTENT EQUIVALENT" and nothing plays.

otherwise realy like where this is heading.
just a web app and cannot connect sometimes
summary: just a web app and cannot connect sometimes

description: When I first saw this I was very excited and installed it immediately. I logged in and saw all of my playlist. I was able click play on an individual tune or click play for the entire playlist. The problem occurs if I want to switch to a different song. It stops responding to user input once it starts playing a tune. In short, every time I want to play a different tune or playlist I have to restart the app and THEN go to the tune or playlist that I want. Obviously this isn't how it should work but I commend the developer for getting it this far. Personally, I'm a programmer and I would be thrilled to help the developer with any bugs or upgrades.
summary: Great effort but still a little clunky

description: it does what it has to

I think is a wrapper on the Apple Music web, need more work, but is an excellent start.

maybe a little more documentation

Thanks dev!
Among all the content error's, minimal customisability and a sloppy web app, there is no point using this.

First off, I pay for Apple Music just for its clean look and the number of songs Apple boasts. I have tried Premium Spotify for a while as well but I couldn't help but stick with Apple Music. (An Android and PC user :p) 
Need to download a DRM protection software which is in kilobytes. I had to use Beta version of this as the normal application when I tried to play my songs displayed 'EQUIVALENT CONTENT'.
Opens a web browser that doesn't seem to show any of my music. Perhaps Apple changed the web interface.

As the summary said. Worked fine until a couple days ago. I tried logging out and back in again, but now I get the following error:

This Browser Is Not Supported
Try listening to Apple Music in the Safari browser.

Clearly Apple updated something and this application now also needs to be updated to continue working. If it can continue working at all.
summary: Worked fine until a couple days ago

description:
Apparently Gnome Software won't let me update a review. It won't even let me remove an old review.

I removed and reinstalled the application and it started working properly again. Gnome Software isn't updating things like it should. So that's where the problem was.
This is exactly what I wanted, an application dedicated to playing Apple Music. I really don't care that it opens a webpage to music.apple.com. Props to this dev
Good work but how do I navigate through it?
Unable to install with unknown package required

Apple is upated something i guess
love this snap and works great
Well, seemeed promising, but literally wont let you play anything.
Developer did a great job on the web wrapper, but it never will work, as Apple locked down their web player to become a Safari exclusive. Until they don't change that back, it won't work. Ever.

description: great app and excelent snap
Can't thank you enough for this! Once I installed Widevine I had to close and reopen this app/container to work but after that it works perfectly!
works well, looks better than itunes on windows
Unusable. App installs and opens ok but does not let you play music. Good idea tho since there is no official Apple app for linux (or is there?).

description: Google music was stopped, itunes for ubuntu using wine doesnt work, but i can enjoy my subscription from my ubuntu now with this version of apple music

Love that this is aple to work on Linux. only problem, no audio. I have configured and reconfigured my audio packages over and over again and can not get audio working. Ehich is depressing to say the least as the audio works fine in the normal browser.
It just works smoothly with your apple subsciption
Something like this has been needed for a while, awesome job Developer!
Finally..... apple music on linux. It looks great and works without any issues!
Is this a malware or what? Because a 80 MB download shouldn't take like 1 hour. What else are you installing. I'm fking done with Ubuntu.

You can simply use music.apple.com website instead of this web-app and make a shortcut for that. The only reason for downloading the application was offline listening which is not available in apple music website. Since this app is just displaying the website it's not available there, either. 
I rather trying installation of offical itunes app by wine on my ubuntu which let you download musics and listen offline.
By the way, spotify is much better than apple music

description: It is almost unusable and provides a crappy desktop experience. Sometimes it doesn't play any song you select, over a certain error called "content_equivalent". Smart playlists are not there. It is impossible to browse intelligently through your songs as there is no way you can jump from a song to its album. Really terrible.
It's browser with hardlinking on apple.music not full-featured app.

I'm using 20.04 and this works fine. I'm able to access all of my currenty existing playlist with no problem and create new ones. I'm not sure what all of the bellyaching is all about. Were you expecting the developer to rewrite iTunes for Linux? Really? Who cares if it's a pass-through? It works! Let's not look a gift horse in the mouth!
Love Apple Music and this is a really good snap to get it in Ubuntu!
it is very good

I couldn't get this working in the UK, probably because it's using applemusic.com and not applemusic.com/uk? I couldnt' see any easy way to switch it over and kept getting "unavailable in your country" warnings on music in my library.
summary: Doesn't seem to work in the UK

I install it under Linux UBUNTU 20.04. After Apple ID registration, did not allowed to play any radio station, becouse "it is not available for my coutry".

I cannot play any song in the app, which is basicly chrome without tabs for internet url

Apple music webplayer plays songs far more reliably. With this software, the stream stop in between. I am not saying this is an issue with this specific software, but stream has to stay consistent for this to be a meaninful alternative of iTunes because I have iPhone and I don't want to use spotify.
gives many open doors that is rare to run two or three desktops at the same time
Love to have my apple music as snap in ubuntu
snap packages are just far too slow, we should just use flatpak as they run much quicker. they are not worth peoples time.
Thanks for this app, its amazing.
Looks fake.. Literally doesn't play any song

It is a bunch of cr*p. I spent 6 hours trying to get this to work. I am a apple music subscriber!!!! I have Apple Music for all my devices. Apple Music works great on all my other devices, including a Samsung phone, a Samsung tablet, an Apple Computer and a Windows Computer. My windows computer when I started Apple Music the first and last time, it asked me to sign in. Apple music appeared to work when I signed in, but it didn't work. After hours of a display that indicated that it was busy downloading my library for 6 hours, I knew something had to be badly wrong!! I have a gigabit internet speed and a extremely fast workstation computer, There is no way it should take 6 hours to download my music collection. I should be able to download every song on the planet several times over, all past songs, all present songs and all future songs combined in that period of time. Apple really dropped the ball on this one.

I have previously tried to get iTunes to run via wine but to no avail. Not to mention the required version was outdated. This app is so much better, but I still can't access my movies & TV shows.. I do wish this had been included with linux Mint's software repository, but the Snap Store should be inclded with EVERY Linux distro in the future.

I've been running this app now for 8 months, and have had no issues with it.

Unlike the app that runs on my AppleTV, this one plays all my playlists, including the unlimited music that I subscribe to.

I can now blast my favorites over my mega speakers attached to my desktop rather than playing them from my iPhone using earbuds.

This is one of my recommended apps to install. I run this on a Ubuntu 20.04 OS with no issues.
summary: Love it - Plays ALL my playlists

description:
There's no way to use media keys in the app and the issue has been present for over two years now. All my media keys work in my web browser, so using the program is just frustrating in comparason.

Further, this application is just a carbon copy of what's on the website. It doesn't add anything the user can't get by just going to music.apple.com in their browser of choice.

There's simply no reason to install this.

L'application marche pas tout le temps, par exemple lors d'une recherche d'un album, quans je clique dessus rien ne s'affiche. La langue est en anglais et on ne peut pas la modifier. Pour une application sortie aujourd'hui elle reste convenable. En espérant que ces petits problèmes soit résolus :D.

C'est simplement l'interface web adaptée en appli.

Tout est long / affichage de playlist / lecture en cours ...

Pas de dark theme.
